BindingPolicyObject.document: This API is used to bind an alarm policy to a specific object.
BindingPolicyObject.name: Binds a policy object.

CreatePolicyGroup.document: This API is used to add a policy group.
CreatePolicyGroup.name: Adds a policy group.

DeletePolicyGroup.document: This API is used to delete an alarm policy group.
DeletePolicyGroup.name: Deletes an alarm policy group.

DescribeAccidentEventList.document: This API is used to get the platform event list.
DescribeAccidentEventList.name: Gets the platform event list.

DescribeBaseMetrics.document: This API is used to get the details of basic metrics.
DescribeBaseMetrics.name: Gets details of basic metrics

DescribeBasicAlarmList.document: This API is used to get the basic alarm list.
DescribeBasicAlarmList.name: Gets the basic alarm list.

DescribeBindingPolicyObjectList.document: This API is used to get the bound object list.
DescribeBindingPolicyObjectList.name: Gets the bound object list.

DescribePolicyConditionList.document: This API is used to get basic alarm policy conditions.
DescribePolicyConditionList.name: Gets basic alarm policy conditions.

DescribePolicyGroupInfo.document: This API is used to get details of a basic policy group.
DescribePolicyGroupInfo.name: Gets details of a basic policy group.

DescribePolicyGroupList.document: This API is used to get the list of basic policy alarm groups.
DescribePolicyGroupList.name: Gets the list of basic policy alarm groups.

DescribeProductEventList.document: This API is used to get the list of product events by page.
DescribeProductEventList.name: Gets the list of product events.

GetMonitorData.document:
This API is used to get the monitoring data of a Tencent Cloud service by passing in its namespace, object dimension description, and monitoring metrics.
API call rate limit: 20 calls/second (1,200 calls/minute). A single request can obtain the data of up to 10 instances and up to 1,440 data points.
This API may fail due to the rate limit if you need to call a lot of metrics and objects. We recommended that you spread the call requests over time.
GetMonitorData.name: Pulls metric monitoring data

ModifyAlarmReceivers.document: This API is used to modify alarm recipients.
ModifyAlarmReceivers.name: Modifies alarm recipients.

ModifyPolicyGroup.document: This API is used to update policy group.
ModifyPolicyGroup.name: Updates policy group

PutMonitorData.document:
The default API request rate limit is 50 requests/sec.
The default upper limit on metrics of a single tenant is 100.
A maximum of 30 metric/value pairs can be reported at a time. When an error is returned for a request, no metrics/values in the request will be saved.

The reporting timestamp is the timestamp when you want to save the data. We recommend that you construct a timestamp at integer minutes.
The time range of a timestamp is from 300 seconds before the current time to the current time.
The data of the same IP metric/value pair must be reported by minute in chronological order.
PutMonitorData.name: Customizes monitoring data to be reported.

SendCustomAlarmMsg.document: This API is used to send a custom alarm notification.
SendCustomAlarmMsg.name: Sends a custom alarm notification.

UnBindingAllPolicyObject.document: This API is used to delete all bound objects.
UnBindingAllPolicyObject.name: Deletes all bound objects.

UnBindingPolicyObject.document: This API is used to delete an object that is bound to a policy.
UnBindingPolicyObject.name: Deletes an object that is bound to a policy.

BindingPolicyObjectDimension.document: Dimensions of instances bound to a policy

CreatePolicyGroupCondition.document: Alarm threshold condition passed in when a policy is created.

members.document: Metric ID.
members.name: MetricId

members.document: Alarm sending and converging type. The value 0 indicates that alarms are sent consecutively. The value 1 indicates that alarms are sent exponentially.
members.name: AlarmNotifyType

members.document: Alarm sending period in seconds. The value <0 indicates that no alarm will be triggered. The value 0 indicates that an alarm is triggered only once. The value >0 indicates that an alarm is triggered at the interval of triggerTime.
members.name: AlarmNotifyPeriod

members.document: Comparative type. The value 1 indicates greater than. The value 2 indicates greater than or equal to. The value 3 indicates smaller than. The value 4 indicates smaller than or equal to. The value 5 indicates equal to. The value 6 indicates not equal to. This parameter is optional if a default comparative type is configured for the metric.
members.name: CalcType

members.document: Comparative value. This parameter is optional if the metric has no requirement.
members.name: CalcValue

members.document: Data aggregation period in seconds. This parameter is optional if the metric has a default value.
members.name: CalcPeriod

members.document: Number of consecutive periods after which an alarm will be triggered.
members.name: ContinuePeriod

members.document: If a metric is created based on a template, the RuleId of the metric in the template must be passed in.
members.name: RuleId

CreatePolicyGroupEventCondition.document: Event alarm condition passed in when a policy is created.

members.document: Alarm event ID.
members.name: EventId

members.document: Alarm sending and converging type. The value 0 indicates that alarms are sent consecutively. The value 1 indicates that alarms are sent exponentially.
members.name: AlarmNotifyType

members.document: Alarm sending period in seconds. The value <0 indicates that no alarm will be triggered. The value 0 indicates that an alarm is triggered only once. The value >0 indicates that an alarm is triggered at the interval of triggerTime.
members.name: AlarmNotifyPeriod

members.document: If a metric is created based on a template, the RuleId of the metric in the template must be passed in.
members.name: RuleId

members.document: Policy group name.
members.name: GroupName

members.document: The value is fixed to monitor.
members.name: Module

members.document: Name of the view to which the policy group belongs. If the policy group is created based on a template, this parameter is optional.
members.name: ViewName

members.document: ID of the project to which the policy group belongs, which will be used for authentication.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: ID of a template-based policy group. This parameter is required only when the policy group is created based on a template.
members.name: ConditionTempGroupId

members.document: Whether the policy group is shielded. The value 0 indicates that the policy group is not shielded. The value 1 indicates that the policy group is shielded. The default value is 0.
members.name: IsShielded

members.document: Remarks of the policy group.
members.name: Remark

members.document: Insertion time in the format of Unix timestamp. If this parameter is not configured, the backend processing time is used.
members.name: InsertTime

members.document: Alarm threshold rules in the policy group.
members.name: Conditions

members.document: Event alarm rules in the policy group.
members.name: EventConditions

members.document: Whether it is a backend call. If the value is 1, rules from the policy template will be used to fill in the `Conditions` and `EventConditions` fields.
members.name: BackEndCall

members.document: The 'AND' and 'OR' rules for alarm metrics. The value 0 indicates 'OR', which means that an alarm will be triggered when any rule is met. The value 1 indicates 'AND', which means that an alarm will be triggered only when all rules are met.
members.name: IsUnionRule

members.document: ID of the created policy group.
members.name: GroupId

members.name: RequestId

members.name: Dimensions

members.name: Timestamps

members.document: The array of monitoring values, which is in one-to-one correspondence to Timestamps
members.name: Values

members.document: The value is fixed to monitor.
members.name: Module

members.document: Policy group ID.
members.name: GroupId

members.document: Alarm sending period in seconds. If the value is less than 0, no alarm will be triggered. If the value is 0, an alarm will be triggered only once. If the value is greater than 0, an alarm will be triggered at the interval of triggerTime.

members.document: Rule ID. No filling means new addition while filling in ruleId means to modify existing rules.
